need.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them
need.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: You don’t really need a car.
Plants need light in order to survive.
The camcorder needs a new battery.
Are you sure that you have everything you need?
More blood donors are urgently needed.
a much needed boost to the local economy
I need you to help me with the cooking.
need.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to feel that you want something very much
need.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: If you need anything, just say.
She needed to go out for a walk.
need.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used in negative sentences when saying that something is not necessary or not always true
need.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Going to the dentist need not necessarily be a painful experience.
You needn’t have spent all that money.
need not have done something/need not do something
need not have done something/need not do something
Jim need never find out what I said.
need.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used when saying that something should have something done to it, or has to have something done to it
need.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The engine will need to be completely checked.
something needs to be checked/cleaned/done etc
The pie doesn’t need to be refrigerated.
something needs to be checked/cleaned/done etc
need.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if a job needs a quality or skill, you must have that quality or skill in order to do it well
need.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The job needs a lot of patience.
Being a teacher needs a high level of motivation.
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You say that you need something
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: You say that you need to do  something
I need to clean the house
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: You say that something needs cutting/cleaning etc  (=it needs to be cut, cleaned etc)
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3]: You say that you need  something  done  (=you want someone to do it for you)
I need my car fixed urgently
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4]: You say that you do not need something
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[5]: You say that you don’t need to do something or you need not/needn’t do  something  (=it is not necessary)
I don’t need to leave until 10
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[6]: You say that someone didn’t need to do something  (=it was not necessary)
I didn’t need to tell him who I was – he already knew
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[7]: You say that someone needn’t have done  something  (=although they have done it, it was not necessary)
We needn’t have ordered so much food
need.translation[0].note_box[0].items[8]: Need is not used in the progressive You say
need.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: need
if you need something, you must have it, because you cannot do something without it
I need your help.
The people desperately need food and clean water.
require
to need something
Children require a lot of attention.
The game requires great skill.
can’t do without something
to be unable to do something without something
A lot of people can’t do without their mobile phones.
could do with something/could use something
to need or want something
Shall we stop? I could do with a rest.
be desperate for something
to need something urgently
Liz was desperate for a cigarette.
The people are desperate for food.
be dependent on something/somebody
to be unable to live or continue normally without something or someone
The refugees are dependent on outside food supplies.
demand
if one thing demands another, it needs that thing in order to happen or be done successfully
The situation is urgent and demands immediate action.
need.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a situation in which something is necessary, especially something that is not happening yet or is not yet available
need.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: There’s a growing need for new housing in many rural areas.
We fully recognize the need to improve communications.
need.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a strong feeling that you want something, want to do something, or that you must have something
need.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Jack did not feel the need to boast about his success.
You’re welcome to come back and talk any time, if ever you feel the need.
need.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: what someone needs to have in order to live a normal healthy comfortable life
need.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: She works to provide for her family’s basic needs.
We have loans to meet your every need.
The charity exists to meet the needs of elderly people.
Schools must satisfy the needs of their pupils.
Environmentalists argue that the organization fails to address the needs of third world farmers.
need.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: when you do not have enough food or money
need.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: cases of severe need in the inner cities
We must care for those in need.
need.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: a real/clear need
There is a real need for after-school care in our area.
an urgent need
The most urgent need was for more teachers.
a pressing/crying need
There’s a crying need for more doctors and nurses.
a desperate need
There is a desperate need to build more housing.
a growing/increasing need
She emphasized the growing need to deal with environmental problems.
stress/emphasize/underline the need for something
He stressed the need for better training courses.
eliminate the need for something
The new drug treatment eliminates the need for surgery.
a need exists
New teaching materials must be created if a need exists for them.
there is a need for something
Clearly there is a need for more research.
there is no need for something
They felt that there was no need for a formal contract.
as/if/when the need arises
Team members move from job to job as the need arises.
if need be
I can work during my lunch break if need be.
